snippet: When the last of its money has been spent, Charles Feeney’s Atlantic Philanthropies will be the largest such organization to have voluntarily shut itself down.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on Charles Feeney, philanthropist who has amassed billion of dollars in wealth only to give it away; notes that Feeney is donating his last $1.5 billion through Atlantic Philanthropies, group of private foundations he created in 1982 and managed to run anonymously for its first 15 years, even though it was one of the largest sources of grants in the United States, Ireland, South Africa and Vietnam.
lead_paragraph: When the last of its money has been spent, Charles Feeney’s Atlantic Philanthropies will be the largest such organization to have voluntarily shut itself down.

headline.seo: A Billionaire Philanthropist Struggles to Go Broke
headline.main: Philanthropist Wants to Be Rid of His Last $1.5 Billion
